section.title: Part C: Execution & Grit
section.subtitle: CAN YOU DO THE WORK? - Your academic execution capacity
section.description: Rate yourself honestly on your ability to execute academic work.

domains.name: Study Habits & Routine
domains.description: Consistency and discipline in daily study

questions.text: I maintain a consistent daily study schedule.
I rarely feel anxious before important tests.
I can write clear, well-structured essays.
I break large assignments into manageable steps.
I have a track record of exceptional academic achievement.
I study without needing external pressure or deadlines.
I can quickly understand and retain new information.
I enjoy conducting research and citing sources properly.
I use tools like calendars and to-do lists effectively.
I challenge myself with advanced courses and materials.
I often procrastinate on homework.
I struggle to recall information during exams.
Writing essays is difficult and stressful for me.
I frequently miss deadlines or submit work late.
I doubt my ability to succeed at top-tier universities.
I have a dedicated study space free from distractions.
I perform well under exam pressure.
I can develop and defend a clear thesis statement.
I prioritize tasks based on importance and urgency.
I seek out intellectually challenging opportunities.
I review my notes regularly, not just before exams.
I use effective test-taking strategies.
I revise my written work multiple times before submitting.
I can manage multiple projects simultaneously.
I am confident I could handle an Ivy League workload.
I get distracted easily when studying.
I freeze up when I don't know an answer on a test.
I avoid writing assignments whenever possible.
I feel overwhelmed by complex projects.
I prefer schools with less competitive academic pressure.
I can focus for extended periods without breaks.
I understand how to study effectively for different subjects.
I can synthesize information from multiple sources.
I set realistic goals and track my progress toward them.
I thrive in rigorous, fast-paced academic environments.
I complete assignments well before the deadline.
I can identify my knowledge gaps and address them.
I am comfortable with different writing styles.
I adapt quickly when project requirements change.
I have received recognition for academic excellence.
My study habits have been consistent throughout school.
I learn from my mistakes on tests and improve.
I can write compelling, evidence-based arguments.
I meet all my commitments and responsibilities.
I am prepared for the intensity of elite universities.
I need frequent reminders to stay on task.
I second-guess my answers during tests.
I struggle to organize my thoughts in writing.
I underestimate how long tasks will take.
I worry about not being academically prepared enough.
